enum.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are not supported and generate a bus error.

enum.name: Value_1

enum.description: Registers cannot be written when locked.
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is enabled. After setting this bit, wait the oscillator startup time before enabling the time counter to allow the 32.768 kHz clock time to stabilize.

enum.description: The 32 kHz clock is not output to other peripherals.

enum.description: DMA is enabled. When DMA is enabled, the DMA request will be generated by original interrupts. The interrupts will not be presented on this module at the same time.

enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic one is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

enum.description: External reference clock is disabled in Stop mode.
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: External reference clock stays enabled in Stop mode if ERCLKEN is set before entering Stop mode.
enum.name: Value_1

enum.description: DMA transfer is enabled and the following conditions trigger the DMA request: While FACK = 0, a data byte is received, either address or data is transmitted. (ACK/NACK automatic) While FACK = 0, the first byte received matches the A1 register or is general call address. If any address matching occurs, IAAS and TCF are set. If the direction of transfer is known from master to slave, then it is not required to check the SRW. With this assumption, DMA can also be used in this case. In other cases, if the master reads data from the slave, then it is required to rewrite the C1 register operation. With this assumption, DMA cannot be used. When FACK = 1, an address or a data byte is transmitted.
enum.name: Value_1

enum.description: Normal operation. No interrupt generated when address matching in low power mode.
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: Enables the wakeup function in low power mode.
enum.name: Value_1

enum.description: An acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving byte (if FACK is set).
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: No acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving data byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving data byte (if FACK is set).
enum.name: Value_1

enum.description: Acknowledge signal was received after the completion of one byte of data transmission on the bus
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: Slave receive, master writing to slave
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: Slave transmit, master reading from slave
enum.name: Value_1

enum.description: Range mode disabled. No address match occurs for an address within the range of values of the A1 and RA registers.
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: Range mode enabled. Address matching occurs when a slave receives an address within the range of values of the A1 and RA registers.
enum.name: Value_1

enum.description: The slave baud rate follows the master baud rate and clock stretching may occur
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: Slave baud rate is independent of the master baud rate
enum.name: Value_1

enum.description: No stop happens on I2C bus
enum.name: Value_0

enum.description: Stop holdoff is disabled. The MCU's entry to stop mode is not gated.

enum.description: All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared.

field.description: Ones complement of peripheral identification bits.
When this bit is set, the USB peripheral is operating in host mode.
This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on an A device.
This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on a B device.
This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected indicating a session valid or a session no longer valid
This bit is set when the USB line state changes
This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires
This bit is set when a change in the ID Signal from the USB connector is sensed.
Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 millisecond
This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software.
Indicates the current state of the ID pin on the USB connector
D- Data Line pull-down resistor enable
D+ Data Line pull-down resistor enable
D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable
This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset
This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur
This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token
This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed
This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms
This bit is set depending upon the DP/DM signals, and can be used to signal remote wake-up signaling on the USB bus
This bit is set when the PID check field fails.
This error interrupt has two functions
This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error.
This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length
This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs
This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data
This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected
This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT.
This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token
Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank
When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling
When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode
Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signaling
In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token
Live USB Single Ended Zero signal
Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal
Provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address.
This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory
This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory
Holds the Endpoint address for the token command
Contains the token type executed by the USB module.
Represents the SOF count threshold in byte times.
Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory
Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.
